ngiemboon: Nkʉ̀ gẅie é líe «Fúʼ gie Ssé nyɛʼɛ nÿɔ́g pʉ̀a wó pɔ́ gyá jʉʼ»
en: A pronouncement   concerning the Valley of Vision:  # 22:1 Ps 125:2; Jr 21:13; Jl 3:12,14

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a Yelúzálèm,
en: The noisy city, the jubilant town,

ngiemboon: Metándá ncù pú, é ka pǔ ńcúʼte ńkÿo.
en: All your rulers have fled together,

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo n gɔɔn né pi ngie:
en: Therefore I said,

ngiemboon: Ńtí nue, áa lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn páʼɔɔn mbà Cʉ̀apʉ̀a,
en: For the Lord God of Armies

ngiemboon: Menùɔ pʉ̀a Elam
en: Elam took up a quiver

ngiemboon: Yelúzálèm, mekélêg ncù pǔ ńdúe mefúʼ mú mie é sí.
en: Your best valleys were full of chariots,

ngiemboon: Aláʼa pà Yúndà cʉ́ʼʉ ńgẅiin pyɛbɛ nnɛ́ wɔ́.
en: He removed the defenses of Judah.

ngiemboon: Pi la gyá páʼ meshʉ̀a pú ńgyɔ́ɔn na metʉ̂ankáʼ mie é kéle jʉʼ gie mé tóŋ lê tÿǒsoŋ fùɔ Ndavîd.
en: You saw that there were many breaches in the walls of the city of David.   You collected water from the lower pool.  # 22:9 2Kg 20:20; Neh 3:16

ngiemboon: Pi la sáŋ mendá mie é laa tÿǒsoŋo Yelúzálèm,
en: You counted the houses of Jerusalem so that you could tear them down to fortify the wall.

ngiemboon: Pi gÿo tɔ́ɔn, á tsetsɛ̀ɛ metʉ̂ankáʼ mémbʉ́a,
en: You made a reservoir between the walls   for the water of the ancient pool,  # 22:11 2Kg 20:20; 2Ch 32:3–4 but you did not look to the one who made it, or consider the one who created it long ago.

ngiemboon: Á laa lyɛ̌ʼ ŋwɛ́, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ,
en: On that day the Lord God of Armies

ngiemboon: Táʼ, à gwɔ̌ pɔ́ legẅe,
en: But look: joy and gladness,

ngiemboon: Táʼ, Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gẅie à piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ,
en: The Lord of Armies has directly revealed to me:

ngiemboon: Nkʉ̀ gẅie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, à tsẅǐ né mèŋ é wɔɔn, à gɔ̌ɔn ngie: «Gʉa ńgyá Shʉbna gẅie aa tsɛ̀ɛ nɔʼ, ńdíe shúm fùɔ, ńgɔɔn né yé ngie:
en: The Lord God of Armies said, “Go to Shebna,   that steward who is in charge of the palace, and say to him:

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ gÿǒ mé túŋ lesyè shú jʉʼɔɔn;
en: What are you doing here? Who authorized you to carve out a tomb for yourself here, carving your tomb on the height and cutting a resting place for yourself out of rock?

ngiemboon: Ɔ̀ kwaŋ pɔ́ ngie ɔ̀ tʉ,
en: Look, you strong man! The Lord is about to shake you violently. He will take hold of you,

ngiemboon: É maʼa gú, ɔ̀ kite páʼ tɔ̌ɔn mmó
en: wind you up into a ball, and sling you into a wide land.   There you will die, and there your glorious chariots will be #— #a disgrace to the house of your lord.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔɔn ngie:
en: I will remove you from your office; you will be ousted from your position.

ngiemboon: Á ge láʼ gwɔ́ lyɛʼó ŋwɛ́,
en: “On that day I will call for my servant, Eliakim son of Hilkiah.

ngiemboon: N ge láʼ tóŋo yé púʼu,
en: I will clothe him with your robe and tie your sash around him. I will hand your authority over to him, and he will be like a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem and to the house of Judah.

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo náa kí ndá fùɔ Ndavîd, á mbwó Eliakim.
en: I will place the key   of the house of David on his shoulder; what he opens, no one can close; what he closes, no one can open.  # 22:22 Jb 12:14

ngiemboon: N ge gÿo nÿɔgɔ yé páʼ
en: I will drive him, like a peg, into a firm place. He will be a throne of honor for his father’s family.

ngiemboon: Epʉ̀a tsɛ̀ɛ tsìŋendá yé ntsèm, é pie é péle na yé, kà pie é náʼa ńgwɔ́ né nzèm wɔ́ɔ, é ge gÿo pú páte pɔ́ na yé páʼ shúm ndá mmɔ̌g, é kyɛte na ntóon la, léfó na káŋ ńgʉa ńkúu na sɔ́ʼ.
en: They will hang on him all the glory of his father’s family: the descendants and the offshoots #— #all the small vessels, from bowls to every kind of jar.

ngiemboon: Cʉ̀apʉ̀a, é Ssé gie e piʼi kɔ̀ɔkɔ́ɔ, ne ńkwéʼe ngyè ye ńgɔɔn ngie: «Atsɔ́ lyɛ̌ʼ ge láʼ gwɔ́, tàʼa tÿǒ wɛ̂ pwɔ́ʼɔ. Tá mbà mé la nÿɔgɔ na jʉʼ gie á tʉte. À ge gÿo pwɔ́ʼɔ, é gwe. Púʼu la, apìʼ gie à kɔ̌ɔn ńkaa, à pú ńcʉŋte.» Yɔɔn aa nò gie Cʉ̀apʉ̀a gɔ̌ɔn.
en: On that day” #— #the declaration of the Lord of Armies #— #“the peg that was driven into a firm place will give way, be cut off, and fall, and the load on it will be destroyed.” Indeed, the Lord has spoken.
